thread.title: Watch the Story of Garrett 'G-Money' Holeve, America's Only MMA Fighter with down's Syndrome
thread.title_full: Watch the Story of Garrett 'G-Money' Holeve, America's Only MMA Fighter with down's Syndrome | Complex UK

author: Corey Pellatt
title: Watch the Story of Garrett 'G-Money' Holeve, America's Only MMA Fighter with down's Syndrome
text:
Move over Ronda Rousey , the sport of MMA has a new people's champion.
Garrett 'G-Money' Holeve lives with Down's syndrome but that hasn't stopped him from chasing his dream of competing in the Octagon and his inspiration story has just been told in a new documentary from The Guardian .
Holeve has been training in Brazilian jiu-jitsu since his formative years but concerns over his condition stopped him from fighting competitively. The documentary charts 'G-Money's' journey to be granted a fight with David Steffan, who lives with cerebral palsy, which would become the world's first MMA fight between two adaptive athletes.
125,000 people signed a petition to let Garrett fight.
Garrett was initially granted a license to fight in his home state of Florida in 2013 before it was revoked shortly afterwards. A petition launched on behalf of Garrett's fight earned 125,000 signatories.
Garrett's mission is to "promote MMA within the special needs community" and it's a fight he's clearly winning.
[via The Guardian ]
